item.title: Home - Strandbeest
item.description: Theo Jansen is engaged in creating new forms of life: the so called strandbeests. Skeletons made from yellow plastic tube (Dutch electricity pipe) are able to walk and get their energy from the wind. They have evolved since their inception in 1990 and have been divided into 12 periods of evolution. Their properties determine this period. You will find the most important types of strandbeests at geneology.

item.title: Study: Air purifier use at daycare centres cut kids' sick days by a third
item.description: The results of the study at two Helsinki daycare centres are still preliminary but promising, a researcher says.

item.title: XAML Reuse with Templates in Applications for Windows and the Uno Platform - Nick's .NET Travels
item.description: XAML is often criticised for being verbose, hard to read and unnecessary as an additional language for defining the interface for an application. This feedback has lead to the creation of C# markup which works with both Windows UI / Windows App SDK and  Uno Platform applications. However, I find that the declarative nature and ... Read more

item.title: You Are NOT Dumb, You Just Lack the Prerequisites
item.description: I always thought I was too dumb to understand math. During my school years, it was evident to me that for some kids math was easy, and for others like myself: painfully difficult.
